Noam Chomskysecuencias

Noam Chomsky is an influential American linguist, philosopher, and political activist. He was born in 1928 and is known as the "father of modern linguistics" for his work developing the theory of generative grammar. Chomsky helped to establish linguistics as a formal, mathematical science and revolutionized the field with his theory that language is a distinct feature of human cognition. In addition to his groundbreaking linguistic theories, Chomsky is also known for his left-wing political views and criticism of U.S. foreign policy, becoming a prominent dissident intellectual by the 1980s.
